title: MY lol won't work
body:
My lol in the very recent patch "PVP.net patcher has stopped working" or something like that and alot of texts. Reinstalling doesn't work nor does Open up the "RADS" folder.
Open up the "Projects" folder.
Open up the "lol_air_client" folder.
Open up the "releases" folder.
Open up the folder that's in there. It changes every patch, but contains the same stuff.
Delete the two files named "S_OK" and "release manifest"
Open up the "deploy" folder.
Delete the "logs", "META-INF", "lol.properties", and "LoLClient.exe"
Restart your Patcher.
doesn't work. Does anyone have a solution? Thanks in advance,
loltkyx

replies.body: I wouldn't recommend outright modifying or removing files as that can cause more issues.  The error you're receiving is usually due to a security setting with your OS that's preventing the patcher from opening or scanning files.  I suggest going over our [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide to restore access.  Let me know if you have any questions!

PvP.net Patcher Kernel errors usually happen as a result of League not having certain permissions to run or interacts with some software packages it relies on. Deleting files inside the directory won't usually resolve this, but if you work through the steps in our [permissions guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions), you'll likely find a solution for this problem.

Let me know if those steps caused any change.
